No Poverty.reason: The course discusses how trade policy affects "income distribution" and "social welfare," which are central to poverty reduction, particularly in the context of "developing countries."
evidence: common trade policies implemented by developing and developed countries

Decent Work and Economic Growth.reason: The course fundamentally explores trade policies' effects on the "international market," "domestic production," and "social welfare," which are core components of economic growth.
evidence: affect the demand and supply of international market

Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure.reason: The course analyzes trade policy tools like "tariffs, quotas, export subsidies" and their impact on "domestic production," which are central to industrial strategy and development.
evidence: common trade policies implemented by developing and developed countries

Reduced Inequalities.reason: The course explicitly states it examines how trade policy affects "income distribution" and includes a specific weekly topic on "trade and income redistribution."
evidence: common trade policies implemented by developing and developed countries

Responsible Consumption and Production.reason: The course mentions "domestic production" and "domestic consumption," but lacks any context of sustainability or resource efficiency to strongly support this goal.

Peace, Justice and Strong Institutions.reason: The course explicitly covers the "World Trade Organization" and "regional free trade agreement," which are key institutions for governing international trade and promoting rule-based cooperation.
evidence: The political economy of trade policy

Partnerships for the Goals.reason: The course focuses on mechanisms of global partnership, including the "World Trade Organization," "regional free trade agreement (FTA)," and the overall "world trade system."
